content: चित् {c1c} <ab>P.</ab> {c10c} <ab>A.</ab> (चेतति, चेतयते, चेतित) {@--1@} To perceive, see, notice, observe; नेषूनचेतन्नस्यंतं <ls>Bk. 17. 16</ls>; चिचेत रामस्तत्कृच्छ्रं <ls n="Bk.">14. 62</ls>; <ls n="Bk.">15. 38</ls>; <ls n="Bk.">2. 29.</ls> {@--2@} To know, understand, be aware or conscious of; परैरध्यारुह्यमाणमात्मानं न चेतयते <ls>Dk. 154</ls>; कादंबरीरसभरेण समस्त एव मत्तो न किंचिदपि चेतयते जनोयं <ls>K. 240.</ls> {@--3@} To regain consciousness. {@--4@} To aim at, intend, design (with <ab>dat.</ab>). {@--5@} To desire or long for. {@--6@} To be anxious about, care for, be intent upon, be engaged in. {@--7@} To resolve upon. {@--8@} To appear, shine. {@--9@} To be regarded as. {@--10@} To make attentive, remind of. {@--11@} To teach, instruct. {@--12@} To form an idea, be conscious of, understand, comprehend, think, reflect upon.

चित् {%<ab>f.</ab>%} [चित्-संपदा° भावे क्विप्] {@--1@} Thought, preception. {@--2@} Intelligence, intellect, understanding; <ls>Bh. 2. 1</ls>; <ls n="Bh.">3. 1.</ls> {@--3@} The heart, mind. {@--4@} The soul, spirit, the animating principle of life. {@--5@} Brahman.
